Subscribe to updates about Open Society’s work around the world

By entering your email address and clicking “Submit,” you agree to receive updates from the Open Society Foundations about our work. To learn more about how we use and protect your personal data, please view our privacy policy.

Awarded Grants

The Open Society Foundations work to build vibrant and inclusive democracies whose governments are accountable to their citizens. The vast majority of the grants made by Open Society are to organizations, but we also award a limited number of grants to individuals through fellowships offered across a number of different programs.

  • Grant and fellowship opportunities
  • About this database

Amount
Region

Apply

  • Physicians for Human Rights

    2019
    $200,000
    Description

    to support advocacy and qualitative research to document sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) in order to promote ongoing international accountability efforts

    Theme

    Democratic Practice

    Referring Program

    Asia Pacific Regional Office

    Term

    2 years

    Region

    Asia Pacific

    Funder

    Foundation to Promote Open Society

  • Research Foundation of CUNY / John Jay College

    2019
    $152,418
    Description

    to conduct a qualitative and quantitative analysis of violence dynamics in two municipalities in Ceará State, Brazil

    Referring Program

    Latin America Program

    Term

    1 year

    Region

    Latin America and The Caribbean

    Funder

    Foundation to Promote Open Society

  • Proteus Fund, Inc.

    2016
    $85,000
    Description

    to support the Grantee's American Society Research Project in conducting qualitative and quantitative interviews that explore the challenge authoritarianism poses to civil society in the United States

    Theme

    Democratic Practice

    Term

    6 months

    Region

    United States

    Funder

    Foundation to Promote Open Society

  • The Secretariat of the Steering Committee of Eastern Partnership Civil Society Forum

    2016
    $55,000
    Description

    to provide support to the Grantee to develop the Eastern Partnership Index (www.eap-index.eu), that provides an infographic compilation of independent quantitative and qualitative data meant to inform national and European civil society, academia and policy makers about the state of reforms and normative alignment in the six EaP countries (Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova and Ukraine)

    Theme

    Human Rights Movements & Institutions

    Referring Program

    Eurasia Program

    Term

    20 months

    Region

    Eurasia

    Funder

    Foundation to Promote Open Society

Subscribe to updates about new grant opportunities

By entering your email address and clicking “Submit,” you agree to receive updates from the Open Society Foundations about our work. To learn more about how we use and protect your personal data, please view our privacy policy.

Voices

Read the latest from our staff, grantees, and partners about how we’re working around the world to build vibrant and inclusive democracies whose governments are accountable and open to the participation of all people.

Learn more

Open Society Barometer

The Open Society Barometer is one of the largest ever studies of global public opinion on human rights and democracy across 30 countries—representing almost 5.5 billion people worldwide.

Explore the results
